dialogues.ALI:
[1]Written by 
[2]When the contract run out. I want black lawyers and managers. Chauncey Eskridge on North La Salle Street... 
[3]I don't need no "protectin'" from myself. Why I need protecting from myself by them...? 
[4]I ain't one of their thoroughbreds! Or their charity things. "Let's do somethin' for that well-behaved colored boy, Cassius." I ain't well-behaved nothing! I am a man. 
[5]And I am not Cassius. I changed my name. I am Muhammad Ali, now. 
[6]That's right. 
[7]No one "made me"... 
[8]I made me. No one's in that ring but me! 
[9]I know who I'm not...I'm not drinkin'! Goin' back on my wife! I am not prayin' to no blue-eyed, blonde-haired Jesus. I ain't... 
[10]You saying I'm just like him? 
[11]Hey, man, where they put the real pilot? What you doin' up here? 
[12]No, man, I meant...in L'ville, when I growed up, they barely let black folks drive buses. 
[13]in the three-car caravan, passes the huge triumphal arch with its giant black star on the top. Thousands line the route to see the heavyweight champion and cheer him. For Ali it's another kind of parade...  
[14]Hey, man!!! 
[15]How you doin'? What's up, brother? I knew you were here...didn't think you were still here... 
[16]We just got here now... And, maaan, the brothers were flyin' a DC 8. Flippin' switches, navigatin', filing flight plans, talkin' French... 
[17]Where you goin'? 
[18]November. 
[19]Man, where should I go?   We're planning on Egypt. 
[20]...shouldn't have quarreled with the Honorable Elijah... 
[21]You shouldn't have... ...quarreled with the honorable Elijah Muhammad... 
[22]You shouldn't have quarreled with Elijah Muhammad. 
[23]Sonji...Sonji Roi... 
[24]'Cause I love it, girl. How long you been workin' for Herbert? 
[25]What kind of name is that? 
[26]What's your father do?  
[27]So who raised you?  
[28]Whatcha doin' tomorrow?       Go ridin' with me.  
[29]I square it with Herbert.       I got a record player in my car.  
[30]Got springs and stuff.  
[31]Yeah. Only one of 'em's smart...the one with the glasses.  
[32]People all screaming and fainting. I asked him, "This the way they act when you get big?"   
[33]He said, "Champ. The more real you get, the more unreal it gonna get." 
[34]Let's go... 
[35]Where you live? 
[36]I think I gonna keep you around forever, girl. 
[37]Herbert said you weren't a Muslim. 
[38]Why? 
[39]I'm no virgin...but I may as well be. I ain't jokin'! I always know when I know. See this face? I mean, you got a pretty face for a girl's face, but you ever seen somethin' as pretty as me? Now, you about five-foot-three...that's too small. But I overlook that, too, 'cause... 
[40]...'cause of your spirit! 
[41]Yeah.   'Cause you too much fun! 
[42]But you gotta be a Muslim. 
[43]Maaan, I ain't never been with a girl like you. 
[44]That's right.   I wanna marry her. 
[45]And get me a kosher cook...lady who cooks at Malcolm's temple. Put my brother on the payroll. 50g a year for drivin' and jivin'. 
[46]Yeah. How 'bout it, Howard. You be my official full-time photographer. 
[47]No. Marriage is the cornerstone of Muslim life. 
[48]She gonna be a Muslim, now! So fix it up, Herbert. 
[49]What you drinkin'? 
[50]What's goin' on?     We're late. 
[51]What questions?! 
[52]What? 
[53]You were the first...you walked me forward, my brother...you were the first... 
[54]meets Liston, nails him with a straight right. Ali begins baiting him, dancing. Liston tries to cut off the ring, jabbing ineffectually. Ali lets Liston in, pulls back, then pivots on his right foot, throws a short right and RAMP INTO SLO-MO...to see Liston not see it coming.  The muscles of Ali's upper body contract and ripple in release after his short RIGHT catches Liston on the point of his chin. Liston drops to the canvas like a stone.  
[55]Get up, sucker! Get up and fight! No one gonna believe this! 
[56]Why you done up like that? 
[57]"Worry"...? 
[58]The world looks at me, girl! What if I straightened my hair, live in the white suburbs? How I am says something! 
[59]Where's Herbert? 
[60]What do I do...? 
[61]Please stay, Brother Herbert. 
[62]I ain't dead! 
[63]Yeah? 
[64]Huh? 
[65]What you talking about? 
[66]You know about this? 
[67]...I flunk their draft board test. Now, without testing if I am "wiser" or "worser," they decide I can go into the Army. 
[68]And I'm not Cassius Clay. That's a slave name. I'm a free man. I'm Muhammad Ali. 
[69]You make a lot of mistakes for a so-called educated man. You really go to law school? 
[70]I'm the best thing that ever happened to you, Howard Cosell. Without me you be a tall white man with a microphone in his mouth. 
[71]Keep talking. You were saying something half-smart... 
[72]Why? I'm no Stokely Carmichael, H. Rap Brown... 
[73]...of a good "Ne-gro," who do what he told? 
[74]I stay out of jail and I get to fight. 
[75]Yes. 
[76]waves in Robert Lipsyte, the New York Times sportswriter in his late 20's we've seen before. He and Howard Bingham, waiting inside, know each other. They enter. The phone's already RINGING.  
[77]Ask Chauncey Eskridge in Chicago. He's my lawyer. No. I'm out on bail. Yeah, I fight. I fight clean. I'm an athlete. Army's there to kill, kill, kill. My religion forbids that. No. I never shot anything in my life. Do I know where Vietnam is? Yeah. It's on TV... In southeast Asia? It there, too? That's a joke, man...! 
[78]What do I think about who?      Vietcong? 
[79]Man, I ain't got no quarrel with them Vietcong. 
[80]No Vietcong ever called me nigger. 
[81]So what? I ain't gonna be what anybody else want me to be. I'm not afraid to be what I want. And think how I want. 
[82]People are following me... 
[83]What? 
[84]They gonna take away what no fighter in the world can? 
[85]What 'bout Terrell? 
[86]Motherfucker. He got a deferment for bein' too tall, or havin' flat feet. Why don't he serve for me? Tellin' me what I should do... 
[87]Yes. 
[88]Apologize? No. 
[89]Yes, sir! 
[90]Yes, sir. I am not going to apologize to you. This isn't a courtroom. And I don't have to sit here and answer your questions. 
[91]I ain't draft dodgin'! I ain't goin' to Canada. I ain't burnin' my draft card. I ain't burnin' the flag. I'm stayin' right here. And you want to throw me in jail? Go ahead. I'll do my time. I been in jail four hundred years. I'll be in jail four, five more. But I ain't goin' ten thousand miles to help murder and kill poor people for you. 'Cause if I'm gonna die, I'll die now, right here, fighting you. If I wanna die. You my enemy, not Vietcong or Chinese or Japanese. You my opposer when I want freedom. You my opposer when I want justice. You my opposer when I want equality. You want me to go somewhere for you, but you won't even stand up for me in America, for my rights and beliefs, you won't even stand up for me here at home. 
[92]What...? 
[93]What you call me...? 
[94]Announce it right here or from flat on your back! 
[95]What's my name?!? 
[96]What's my name, motherfucker?! 
[97]What's my name? 
[98]
[99]My name?! WHAT'S MY NAME?! 
[100]If the court would give me my sentence right now instead of waiting and stalling. 
[101]Watch now... 
[102]Blow on it... 
[103]This spooky! Don't get scared... 
[104]So what's fresh, girl? 
[105]What's the freshest of the freshest? 
[106]Feed me those things, I gotta come back as a wrassler. 645 pounds. I'd still be pretty...but I be fat pretty... 
[107]I remember something...   Wha's your name? 
[108]You had a long braid... 
[109]That was you? 
[110]You see the Ellis-Quarry fight? 
[111]Ellis the champ? Man. I beatin' on him since we was sixteen. They give Ellis to Joe Frazier? Frazier'll kill him. Then they out of juice. Where's the gate? So they gotta let me fight. I fight Ellis in a phone booth...middle of Times Square...you think that draw a crowd? 
[112]Tijuana? 
[113]Can't fight here. Can't fight outside the country... 
[114]Why I want to be in the restaurant business?! 
[115]How much all this gonna cost? 
[116]Look out! 
[117]Not then... 
[118]I always tell the truth... 
[119]Thought we already got turned down there. 
[120]Where the money come from, Chauncey? Herbert tell me I'm runnin' on empty. Put aside "how do that happen"? Licenses all revoked. No passport. I can't fight here. Can't fight abroad. And what happen if I lose the Supreme Court? 
[121]Man give him a shot, he took a shot. 
[122]How's he? 
[123]I'll call 'em, I'll call 'em... May-may! It go in one end and come out the other. 
[124]You so much better at it, mama. 
[125]Maaan...Joe Frazier can't talk, can't up the gate, can't fill the arena. They gotta let me fight. 
[126]I need Angelo, Rudy, Ferdie -- 
[127]Cosell? This Muhammad Ali. 
[128]Go to Georgia or Alabama or Sweden. Everybody know I'm the champ. The crown is a lie. I know it's a lie. Joe Frazier know it's a lie. It time for everybody to stop lying and tell the truth. 
[129]I ain't interested in the paycheck, I'd fight Joe Frazier for free in a phone booth in Times Square, if I wasn't broke. I still will. 
[130]I'm saying it's time for everybody to quit lying! Muhammad Ali is the champ! I have to, I'll get the fight on myself. And if they offer me money, I ain't gonna turn it down. 
[131]You can't call me that no more. 
[132]Whyn't you call an ambulance or a doctor? 
[133]What's wrong with you, man?! 
[134]I leave you alone.   You called me! 
[135]What you shame yourself like this for, maaan...?! Why you shame yourself?! 
[136]You know "low." You so low, the curb look like up! 
[137]Those rhymes is old.    Forget 'em. 
[138]Yeah. 
[139]No. There's no "back" to take you to... 
[140]...you can't do what you do best in the world. And how you feed your family? From prison? Who take care of your kids? And is Allah, is God with me? 
[141]A thousand dollars to the man who brings me Howard Cosell's toupee! Dead or alive! 
[142]Put me on, Howard. 
[143]I guarantee...it will be a historical and momentous night! 
[144]...what Heavyweight Champion of the World? I'm not the champ. I am retired, finished, out of the game. And I ain't gonna let myself grieve and suffer none. But I know I will not fight again... 
[145]If tomorrow they say: "We want you to fight Joe Frazier. Madison Square Garden. Millions and millionses of dollars. Here's your license back." I will tell them: "I am sorry, but I am done." 
[146]You'll have to wonder...what me and Smokin' Joe would have looked like. 
[147]Howard, you losing your hearing along with your hair? Don't put questions to it! I am through fighting. 'Cause I got a bigger and more important match comin' up. The U.S. government. A heavier contender. 
[148]I don't know, but it's going to be a shocking and terrible fight. In fact, they might wish they let me stay in boxing. 
[149]There you go, agitatin'. You ask Smokin' Joe what he been smokin'?! Joe Frazier even dream he can whup me? He better wake up and apologize... But, if I WAS to jump in the ring with Joe, here's what you might see... Ali comes out to meet Frazier, If Frazier goes back an inch farther, Ali swings with a left, Ali swings Frazier keeps backin', but there's It a matter of time before Ali Now Ali lands with a right, what 
[150]a beautiful swing, out of the ring. referee wears a frown, Frazier come down. view. And the crowd is getting frantic. him up. He's somewhere over the Atlantic. they came to this fight, launching of a black satellite? 
[151]But don't wait for they fight. 'Cause it ain't never gonna happen. You only can wonder and imagine... 
[152]You want me to buy you a drink? 
[153]I don't wanna fight no more.   Not with you... 
[154]Who dress you, Joe?   You look like Dale Evans. 
[155]To be closer to you, honey. 
[156]There be two undefeated heavyweight champions! And they ain't fighting! 
[157]'Cause you gotta get behind this and we gotta do this. 
[158]You wanna get this on, Joe?     You and me? Or not?! 
[159]I can fight in Atlanta. 
[160]Georgia ain't got no state boxing commission. And Atlanta got a black city council; a liberal Jewish mayor, Sam something. It all set. I do a prelim in Atlanta with Jerry Quarry. But we got to get the steamroller movin' now. 
[161]You announce that if I beat Quarry you give me the title shot. So what you say...maaan? 
[162]But you know you ain't the champ yet. 
[163]I'm fine. Thanks. 
[164]What you want? 
[165]You want me to take you back? 
[166]You can't hit what you can't see. 
[167]All praise to Allah... ...Alaikum Salaam... 
[168]You saying I can be a Muslim again, Herbert? 
[169]I never stopped. Like I never stopped being champ. 
[170]When? After I promoted Quarry fight? After I won it? 
[171]I already got Frazier. 
[172]Are we talking management, talking money or talking religion? 
[173]When I got leery and talked up how come I'm broke, then came the suspension. Now, you explain that to me, my brother...? 
[174]I love the Nation, Herbert. I love Elijah Muhammad. But it don't own me. 
[175]Now, you go on out. And you make the Frazier deal. 
[176]Yeah... 
[177]What are you talking about, Howard? Quarry? 
[178]I'm free. 
[179]Supreme Court set me free. 
[180]Hook's comin'. Lean back, man! Move back! WORK LEGS...! 
[181]is exhausted.    Labored breathing.     The crowd cheering Frazier.  
[182]Shut up! I lost. Get outta here... 
[183]Where's Belinda? 
[184]My hands was in sand, Angie.     My feet in water... 
[185]Woulda, shoulda, coulda... After three-and-a-half years, this...from how far back...comeback is. 
[186]I lost. You lose, you don't shoot yourself. The world goes on. 
[187]Oh, how wrong he is. 
[188]I ain't dead, baby!     C'mon. 
[189]I can move my jaw with my tongue. He got me... 
[190]Ain't stoppin' nothin'...! Nothin' stoppin'...! 
[191]Foreman call me one time after he won the Olympics... 
[192]So. 
[193]You think I still got the tools? 
[194]Well, you better sharpen 'em up. 'Cause we goin' to Africa. 
[195]It's time to be heavyweight champion of the world again. 
[196]Man, you crazy. 
[197]What are they saying, man?!!!    Why they saying that? 
[198]What's that mean?!   I don't understand! 
[199]What?! 
[200]Ali, boma ye! 
[201]Ali, boma ye! 
[202]Fast. Six left jabs flash from his chest and shoulder, followed by a right hook and left and right uppercuts. 
[203]Back up, maaan... ...you fast! 
[204]Ali, boma ye George Foreman! 
[205]You out, sucker! 
[206]looks at the backs of the signs. He and we realize the signs' purpose: to hide the makeshift plastic walls and rooms made from cardboard containers and oil drums from the foreigners traveling the road to Kinshasa. One TEENAGER WITH A WITHERED ARM and a big smile runs up...  
[207]Foreman?   I kill him! 
[208]looks at individual faces. A grinning OLDER MAN with a blue transistor radio . A smiling kid. A girl with no shoes. A teenage kid jumping up and down...all looking at him. Ali makes four pieces of rope appear. He rubs them together...   
[209]Shazaam!!! 
[210]...even if I die here. If it kill me, no matter what...I gotta win. 
[211]Howard! How many you ugly sportswriters in there got me over Foreman? Don't lie. 
[212]What's the odds? 
[213]This'll be the biggest upset since Sonny Liston. I want all of you to write it down! This fight is no contest! 
[214]George Foreman is a big mummy. I've officially named him "The Mummy." 
[215]George punches are like "Look out, here come the left." Whomp! Here come the right! Whomp! Like a Mummy. But "The Mummy" can't hit what it can't see. I'm fast! Gonna dance. Be all over George. George is gonna feel he surrounded. And I done somethin' new for this fight; I done rassled with an alligator. 
[216]That's right! I have rassled with an alligator. I done tussled with a whale. I done handcuffed lightning, thrown thunder in jail. That's bad! Only last week I murdered a rock. Injured a stone. Hospitalized a brick. I'm so mean, I make medicine sick. 
[217]Howard. I didn't want to talk about this, especially in front of everybody. But I talked to your wife! And she told me you're not the man you used to be...two years ago! 
[218]Salaam Alaikum, brothers! The champ is here! 
[219]Bottled water. Frozen steaks. Brought all this stuff like Africans don't have steaks... 
[220]They eat it.  
[221]Mobutu eats it...  
[222]So? What's that do with any of why we here?  
[223]Here come "Herbert."  
[224]Money? I do "money-making" whenever I want. Money is easy.  
[225]Don King delivered the first black- promoted championship fight in Africa!   
[226]'Cause clean-cut Muslims parading on the South Side of Chicago don't get this done! I got to put honkeys with connections and bad- ass niggers to it, too. 
[227]That what this is? Think I gonna lose? Puttin' doubt on me? 
[228]Sure. 
[229]Truth is...George knocked hisself out. 
[230]That's right. He did three rounds. Knew he was gonna lose to Muhammad Ali and knocked hisself out. And I predict that whenever the fight is set, he might not show up! 
[231]I'm a bad man! 
[232]And you tell the same thing to George. 
[233]I been watchin' you! I heard you. I know he's your man. I know you got him picked. But the man's in trouble. 
[234]The whole world was gonna know. But, now, he ain't gonna show. That's why he knocked hisself out when he was training. 
[235]Uh-huh. I want all helicopters guarded! Private boats. Private jets. I want the airport -- I'm serious -- I want President Mobutu and all his paratroopers. Mobutu and all his paratroopers. I want all of you "Zaireans" to be on guard! Watch all strange boats tryin' to slip away! They might be takin' him out. 
[236]Yeah. Watch the bus station. Watch everything! Elephant caravans. He might sneak out by elephant. 
[237]Hey!!! 
[238]Don't talk to Angelo like that! Don't you talk to him like that ever again!!! 
[239]You think you're callin' these shots, Don? You're not. 
[240]They know! All those ladies out there know. 
[241]They know I'm ready! I see fear in the eyes of his followers! I see fear! This is the fight that Muhammad Ali was supposed to be ended. The myth of Muhammad was supposed to fall! Supposed to be my destruction! They miscalculated. They misjudged. They got it...wrong. 
[242]Say, girl...! 
[243]C'mere.   I know you? 
[244]What's your name? 
[245]Like the sports car. 
[246]But with a little something extra. Veronica, I know you now. C'mere, sit down. 
[247]You with Don? 
[248]Where you from? 
[249]Well...they all came together real nice. 
[250]All them writers in there think Foreman gonna...kill me! What you think? 
[251]You been to Hong Kong?   Taiwan? Thailand? 
[252]I can't go there. All the ladies out there from Indonesia, Japan, Hawaii, India... "Ali-i-i-e-e-e! Ali-e-e-e! Oh, Muhammad Al-i-i-i!" You seen those people from Thailand? I was in Bangkok -- I couldn't walk. I couldn't...I just couldn't do nothin'. "Get me outta this country!" The women were so pretty... 
[253]Ladies in Thailand, their hair comes down to their knees...and they about Veronica's complexion...and they bad! 
[254]But they ain't nothin' like the "sisters." Ain't NOTHIN' like the sisters! 
[255]Let's go for a ride. 
[256]shows the scarf, pushes back his cuffs so that he can't hide anything up his sleeves. His wrists are bare. He shows both sides. Now, he takes the scarf and pushes with his right hand and feeds it into the closed fist of his left. He looks up wide-eyed at everybody. Then, he opens his fingers and the scarf is not there!  
[257]So why you glad we still here? 
[258]That's one job.    I got two... 
[259]...gotta whup George! 
[260]Listen, girl, as a Muslim, I am busted out and failed in the eyes of God. I shoulda discovered Islam at 50! 'Cause I am weak on women. They take my eyes and my heart follow...causing me to be a lovin' husband and a terrible husband...! ...green eyes and cocoa skin...? ...okay, rest of me, let's go!! 
[261]Faster! Faster! 
[262]Why not? 
[263]Hey! Look! Look at George Foreman's trainer, feelin' me up on purpose! On the side, to see if I'm in shape! 
[264]We'll, you ain't gonna find no fat! Watch out!! 
[265]She's gotta put it on. 
[266]"George" buttons is all I got. In my bedroom! All over the bed! Everywhere! To remind me...of all of ya'. All of ya'! Reminds me of all ya'! 
[267]Yeah. 
[268]When did you get in? 
[269]You know what's going on. 
[270]I didn't mean for it to come out... 
[271]I know that. 
[272]I didn't mean for it to be... 
[273]I don't want to hurt you. It's wrong. You're a good wife to me. 
[274]I respect you.   I always respect you. 
[275]I follow my heart. 
[276]I fight George. I didn't come this far to quit. 
[277]Thanks to Allah... 
[278]Why? 
[279]Foreman ain't no mummy. He's knocked out eight out of eleven before the end of the third round. He the most dangerous fighter I ever fought. 
[280]And I can't WAIT! 
[281]sheds his robe, now, and throws a blistering array of jabs and hooks. The crowd goes nuts. Ali looks ringside and sees...  
[282]Motherfucker, you 'bout to discover you ain't nothin'. 
[283]You been hearin' about me for years. All your life you been hearin' about Muhammad Ali. Now you gotta face me. 
[284]You never should have come to Africa. 
[285]Legs heavy...air's heavy...like sand... 
[286]turns away.     Nevertheless, it crashes into his jaw.  
[287]That all you got...?   That it? 
[288]There is nothin'... Nothin'! ...I cannot take. 
[289]Thought you was bad! 
[290]Here come George's "murder" round. 
[291]ties up Foreman's left in the crook of his elbow, and they stagger, married, awkwardly, into the center of ring. The referee separates them.  
[292]George!    Show me something. 
[293]Where's your punch, man?! 
[294]...been here before. 
[295]Open the door, Richard...outta this room... Put on your coat, man...get out... 
[296]Think my fight's over...? That... ...all you got? That the hardest you hit? 
[297]C'mon, chump!!! 
[298]Took somethin' away from him, Angie, that round... 
[299]They don't know what's happenin'. 
[300]You bet the wrong horse! He can't fight no better than you can act! 
[301]covers with gloves at his head. Elbows at his ribs. When head shots come in, Ali slips them the right or left, or turns them into glancing shots, or just leans straight back so that they all fall short by quarter of an inch. The BELL.  
[302]covering, taking the most powerful hooks Foreman's thrown in the fight, one after the other to the body.   
[303]Take it! Terrify him with what you can take... 
[304]Eight more rounds... You runnin' outta gas? 
[305]...can't let you get that second wind which you don't know is out there for you. 
[306]Want the title...wear the heavyweight crown? Jaw broke? Nose smashed? Face busted? You ready to die? Is that you? 'Cause you gonna meet a man who will die before he let you win. 
[307]hits Foreman with a left. Foreman launches a short left that Ali counters with a BIG RIGHT CROSS that connects.  
[308]Now... 
[309]
[310]I don't know what's gonna happen. Maan, everything is crazy. 
[311]You think you got a chance, chump? Now you in trouble. 
[312]You even dream of beating me?   You better wake up and apologize! 
[313]He too much for me!
dialogues.BUNDINI:
[1]Pounds of what?! 
[2]I'm called Bundini, rhymes with Houdini. He was a Jew, too...some other people call me Fastblack...or Daddy Mac... 
[3]Shorty sent me to Sugar Ray Robinson. I gave my power to Sugar Ray for seven years, gave him my voodoo, my magic. Now Shorty sent me to you. 
[4]I call him Shorty 'cause he like 'em circumcised. Original people. Like Moses. And I was a babe in a basket, too. I was born on a doorstep with a note 'cross my chest that read, "Do the best you can for him, world." I had to suck the first nipple come along. I didn't run away from home...I been runnin' to home. 
[5]Now, I gotta ask you. You fixin' them fights? Else no way you could tell great Archie Moore what round you droppin' him in...all of them predictions you make, comin' true. Never heard of nobody predictin' the round like you. You either a phony or Shorty's in your corner. Tell me the truth, young man... 
[6]'Cause I'm gonna be your Inspiration. Your motivator. In your corner. Can I be in your corner, young man? 
[7]Ain't spent much time in Miami. Where the water? 
[8]True love! 
[9]What were you doin' down at a cocktail lounge, Herbert? Sellin' "Muhammad Peeks"? 
[10]I got to know about Sonji, Muhammad. She got a sister? 
[11]What am I drinkin'? Water's what I'm drinkin', champ! I'm a natural man... 
[12]Come on in...! What's that? 
[13]That was before... 
[14]Before you showed up... 
[15]"Satisfied?"...satisfaction is not makin' it with the woman who send you to the moon? 
[16]Man, I'm the only normal person left around here and I'm a black Jew who can't read and is half drunk. 
[17]He so pretty, when you look up "pretty" in the dictionary, he too pretty to be there. 
[18]Champ.   It's Eskridge... 
[19]Watchu' doin' here? Gimme that short dog! 
[20]Nothin' wrong with me! 
[21]What that?!!! 
[22]Leave me alone! 
[23]That were a week ago... 
[24]Lemme alone! I'm flyin'! The Sky Chief talk through me. I know the word! 
[25]Yeah? The king gotta go home to his throne! From the root to the fruit...! 
[26]God don't care about you! Don't care about me! In all of everything, we mean nothin'. He don't know us. We be. And that's the onliest thing he did. And that's good 'cause that's why we free. But free ain't easy. Free is real. And realness is a motherfucker... It eats raw meat. It walk in its own shoes. It does not waver... Yeah... 
[27]I sold your belt for five hundred dollars to a barber on Lenox Avenue. That's how low I did you. I'm filled with weakness and got a crazy mind. That belt say you the Heavyweight Champion of the World. Five hundred dollars and I put it into my arm. That's what I called to tell you... 
[28]...heard 'bout the Nation, all that court stuff. 
[29]Forgive me, Muhammad.    Take me back... 
[30]Take me back, boss. 
[31]I'm clean. And you a resurrection. This is God's act. Anybody love poor people and little people and fucked-up people gotta be a prophet. 
[32]And the prophet is going home. You the sun. Let me live in the light. Take me with, boss. ...I'll do anything. 
[33]Float like a butterfly, sting like a bee. 
[34]You the man! You Superman! Ain't no kryptonite in this ring tonight! 
[35]That's 'cause they know the king is gonna go home to his throne. And they know everybody's with you, now. And they wanna be on the RIGHT side! 
[36]The motherland. From the root to the fruit. We gonna rumble...in the jungle. 
[37]Yeah, man! 
[38]Succubus? Suck my dick. They ain't room in Africa for more than one witch doctor. And that's B'dini. 
[39]meanwhile, has thrown his arms around Dick Sadler, Foreman's manager. (We realize this is why Ali segued from serious work to snapping his traditional left jab.  
[40]I got him! Lock him up. 
[41]throws towels across Ali's shoulders. Ali puts on his long African robe, which is white with African-graphic trim on the cuffs of the sleeves and the hem.  
[42]Forget every battle of man against man, of mind against mind, of soul against soul. This is the one. This is the greatest. 
[43]This is it. 
[44]The prophet's come back to claim his own! Get the pretender off that throne! 
[45]Dance, dance! 
[46]You gotta move! Stick and MOVE!
dialogues.CASSIUS:
[1]Sonny Liston: you ain't no champ! You a chump! You want to lose your money, bet on Sonny. He know I'm great. He will go in eight! 
[2]What you lookin' at, you ugly bear?! 
[3]C'mon, bum. I whup you right here! 
[4]You sure you got that right...? 
[5]Pounds of ugly! He so ugly, sweat run backwards off his forehead to get away from his face! C'mon, bear! I turn you into a rug!! Rumble right now, man! 
[6]You whup me, I'll crawl out of the ring on my knees and catch the next jet plane out of the country. 
[7]...you be the first eatin' his words! 
[8]I'm scared of no man. I give Sonny Liston talking lessons, boxing lessons and falling down lessons. 
[9]"Black Muslim"'s a press word... 
[10]Howard Cosell, you are an instigator! How you get that way? When I'm done with Liston, I'm comin' for you! 
[11]Who Shorty? 
[12]...I study every fight. 'Til I got a plan. Wear him down two through four. Drop him in the fifth round. So the p'diction ain't a p'diction. It's a plan. And 'cause of all the poppin' off I do, I know I gotta win! That's the truth. And why I'm tellin' you? 
[13]Yeah... 
[14]When you get back? 
[15]You could have stayed. Nobody gotta hide when they with me. 
[16]throws his long left jab. It keeps Liston at a set distance. He has Liston's range, now, and he dances away from Liston's charges. Then, halfway through the round, Cassius' eyes have hunted out an opportunity, and he throws his first combination with a few hard shots that, to Liston's surprise, rock Liston's head back. And, then, Cassius easily evades...  
[17]keeps tagging Liston with his long left. And, now, infuriates Liston even more by merely walking away from Liston's big misses, provoking even wilder and more inaccurate Liston assaults. (We're aware that any Liston shot could knock out Cassius if it connected.) Then Cassius soaks up a couple of body shots, most flicks his jab, slides, dances, clinches, circles away...UNTIL...  
[18]He was supposed to kill me.   Well, I'm still alive. 
[19]He's nothin' to me... 
[20]And he knows it... 
[21]...my eyes! 
[22]My eyes! I can't see...somethin' in my eyes! 
[23]Cut 'em off! Cut 'em!   I'm blind. 
[24]I upset the world! I am the greatest! I am the greatest! 
[25]Eat your words! Eat your words! 
[26]I told you. Didn't I tell you? 
[27]I had him in the first round. 'Cause I'm the greatest! Sam... Hey, Sam! Let him up. 
[28]I am the greatest! And he the greatest rock 'n' roll singer. Sam Cooke! I want everybody to bear witness. I shook up the world! Don't have a mark on me! I was burning. I was blind. I'm the prettiest thing that ever lived. I shook up the world! I shook up the world! 
[29]The Mummy! "I can't get away from the mummy!" Yeah, but that mummy too slow to catch anybody. 
[30]No, he don't! Now, don't believe that stuff on television... 
[31]Yeah. I going to be a people's champ... But not like Joe Louis, exactly... 
[32]And I'm not Clay. Clay's the name of the people who owned by ancestors. I don't want to be called after that slave name no more. So I'm "X." Cassius X. And I'm a member of the Nation of Islam. The Honorable Elijah Muhammad is my spiritual guide. Malcolm X is my mentor. 
[33]"Card-carrying"...? Don't need no "card." You got a Christian card? 750 million people believe in Islam. I'm one of them. 
[34]I'm going to be a people's champion. But I don't have to be the way you want me to be. I'm gonna be what I want. And I'm free to think any way I want... 
[35]...watchin' a show on termites...they knockin' down this house, here. 
[36]Six million in your house and you don't know it. Where? 
[37]Africa? No. Only Rome.      Yeah, man, let's go! 
[38]When we leaving? 
[39]What is it? 
[40]Tore out a picture of Emmett Till when I was little. Couldn't take my eyes to it...couldn't look at it. Barb-wire around his neck to a 75- pound cotton-gin fan. Took out his eye. The cruelty to it...I couldn't look at it...couldn't throw it away. 
[41]I thought, "What I do wrong to be so low that people could do that to people like me?" It made me feel ashamed. And that makes no sense. But that's what it was. 
[42]You can fix that... 
[43]Muhammad Ali. "Worthy of praise..." Thank you! 
[44]Yes, sir. 
[45]This is a great honor, Messenger...
dialogues.BELINDA:
[1]See, you don't need to fight no more... 
[2]Everything fresh! 
[3]Doughnuts just came out... 
[4]You don't remember when you met me once before...long ago... 
[5]You know my name! You came to my school, right before you win the title. Interviewed you for the school paper. I was eleven. 
[6]Yeah! You called me little Indian girl, then. 
[7]I loved you then, like all those kids. I never stopped. I still do. 
[8]First time? 1961...Sister Khalilah introduced you at assembly. You said you would be heavyweight champion of the world by the time you were twenty-one! 
[9]I was eleven. I interviewed you for the student paper. You called me "little Indian girl," 'cause I wore my hair real long, in a braid...I told you..."Man, you scribble! You can't even write! You ought to go back to school until you do it better..." 
[10]She's got to be done with that bottle. 
[11]No, he didn't. I told them about the one on the way...myself. 
[12]You wanna try changing her, for the experience? 
[13]That happen, you promise me you put some new people around you. 
[14]Where are they when we need them? You got Gene Kilroy droppin' off groceries like charity. Borrowin' money from my folks. So...? 
[15]Muhammad...? 
[16]Hell, I can't. I'm defying them by talking to you. And being with you. 
[17]...you don't need their management... 
[18]My God.    They killed you! 
[19]Here's your water. 
[20]You could pick up parasites... 
[21]You're seeing what you want to see, Muhammad...  
[22]Mobutu is taking care of Mobutu and stealing all the wealth and sending it to Switzerland...  
[23]We're here 'cause Don King got Mobutu to put up ten million dollars. Don King don't give a damn about Africa. He worse than Herbert.  
[24]Yeah. 'Cause where was he when we was broke and borrowing money? And Bundini and all them that "love you"? Disappeared, is where they were. All over you when you got it and drop off you when you don't...  
[25]And Don King fit right in...that double-breasted hipster is now a dashiki-wearing rip-off.  
[26]Don King talks black, lives white and thinks green! Why you defending him and "brother" Herbert? 
[27]And now they got you up against George Foreman. Do they give a damn you could get killed? 
[28]I think: why is my Muslim husband letting himself get strung up on a cross...? It means, "tell me." 
[29]Maryum is sick. Maybe I oughta go back to Chicago and look after her. 
[30]I'll be back before the fight. If that's all right, my husband... 
[31]Hello, Muhammad. Bingham.    Mr. Cosell. 
[32]Just now. Muhammad, may I have a word with you, please? 
[33]What is going on? 
[34]But I don't have to have it thrown in my face. I don't have to read about it and have people call me up on the phone about it... 
[35]Oh, hell, Muhammad, you got no discretion. You never did. You humiliate me! 
[36]I clean for you. I cook for you. I feel every punch you take. 
[37]Then why you got to be visible with women? 
[38]I live with the casual ones. But this, this...I can't hold it together anymore. 
[39]Then why do you disrespect me this way?! 
[40]Do you love her? 
[41]Do you want to marry her? 
[42]"You're following your heart"? That's what you do. No matter what anybody says. Or thinks. Or what it does... And what happens now? 
[43]Neither of us did. 
[44]...I didn't come this far to quit.
dialogues.HOWARD COSELL:
[1]...cannot stand you, Cassius.   He really wants to kill you... 
[2]commentary with Les Kelter's blow-by-blow 
[3]Sonny Liston is not coming out! Wait a minute! Wait a minute! Sonny Liston is not coming out! 
[4]The winner...and the new heavyweight champion of the world is Cassius Clay! 
[5]What made him so easy for you? 
[6]Was there any single point you knew you had him? 
[7]...the arena is surrounded by FBI, the stands are only half full, the promoter has taken out a million- dollar insurance policy due to Cassius Clay's membership in the militant and radical Black Muslims because of death threats. Oh, and by the way...Sonny Liston is here, too. 
[8]Liston is down! Scarcely a minute into the first round, I can't believe it! 
[9]It's over; it's over! 
[10]Cassius, it is my opinion you... 
[11]You know, I apologize to you. On the air. Your name is Muhammad Ali. You have the right to be called whatever you want. 
[12]Yes, Muhammad. And to think I gave up a lucrative practice for the likes of you. 
[13]And without me...you'd be a mouth. 
[14]We'll be right back. 
[15]Have a little coffee with your sugar...? 
[16]They want to make an example out of you. 
[17]All they are is political. They tell people how they ought to be. But you are the HEAVYWEIGHT CHAMPION of the WORLD. You're important. And they don't like your militancy, your politics. So, they'll make an example out of you. 
[18]Yes. Or, to demonstrate here is what happens to your ass if you don't... 
[19]What are your feelings about up- and-coming Ken Norton? 
[20]Hold on one second...we have a caller. Go ahead. 
[21]Let's tell it like it is. With your court and boxing problems, Muhammad, can you get a fight promoted? 
[22]Did you say you were broke?   How can you be broke? 
[23]You've made more money than all previous heavyweight champions combined. What about your management? Surely they have provided for you... 
[24]Don't bother me. I'm a world- famous broadcaster and you're an ex-champion with diminished skills. I can't be seen you, it would be calamitous to my reputation. 
[25]Muhammad, I'd do anything for you. But I got bosses who only give a damn about Nielsen ratings. 
[26]I thought you were resolute in your resolve to regain your crown... 
[27]What about Frazier? 
[28]You surprise me, Muhammad... 
[29]Do you think you're going to jail? 
[30]Joe Frazier told me on this show he would knock you out. 
[31]Muhammad, you T.K.O.'ed 'em... 
[32]No. "The Supreme Court ruled today in the case of the United States vs. Cassius Clay, a.k.a. Muhammad Ali..." You won an 8-0 unanimous decision. You're free. 
[33]Ali was out! He was out on his feet. Joe almost had him. Frazier must have thought Ali was playing possum. 'Cause Ali's a clown. Others have come in on Ali when he's playing possum and gotten knocked out. 
[34]
[35]Some of us...Norman, me...are worried. How you gonna dance against George?? He's sparring with a middleweight, training to cut you off. He gets you against the ropes, he can knock you out with either hand. 
[36]Two-and-a-half-to-one. Against. We're worried you're going to get hurt. 
[37]Muhammad, I'm sorry. I have to ask. Are you really fast enough, anymore? To beat George Foreman? Many people believe you don't have the same skills, that you are not the same man you used to be ten years ago. 
[38]Hi...Mrs. Ali.
dialogues.ANGELO DUNDEE:
[1]
[2]Yeah. Like that, Daddy. Don't jump in one place. Bad for the heart. That's the most important thing. 
[3]
[4]Man's religion's his own business. What kinda question's that? 
[5]Howard! 
[6]He's right. 
[7]No. You quit, it's over! Get out there. Be a yardstick. This is the big one, daddy. Get out there and run! 
[8]
[9]Weight's comin' down. 222. 
[10]What are you talking about? 
[11]Hell of a fight, champ... 
[12]Ferdie, take a look at this... It was still a hell of a fight. 
[13]Maybe we shoulda had more time between Blin and this, you know...to get back into... 
[14]So we only eked this one out. And George Foreman makes Frazier look like a sissy. 
[15]...but, you go? We're the corner, same as always. But it ain't gonna be easy. 
[16]You got the tools, Daddy.     But they different. 
[17]What are you talking about? 
[18]Can he fight? 
[19]Are you tryin' to pull something, Don? Ali wants his title. And he wants it back in Zaire. George leaves, he ain't comin' back. George don't like it here. 
[20]What do you expect us to do, Don? 
[21]If George goes? You forfeit five million. You crawl back to Cincinnati. You ain't promotin' a charity raffle... 
[22]The bus station. 
[23]What you say? 
[24]He gone? 
[25]Give us a moment. Alone. Hey. This is my religion! 
[26]It's hot. Humid. Monsoon season's about to start. May hit 140 in the ring under the lights. You all right? 
[27]Where you at? 
[28]I'd worry if I was hearin' anything else. 
[29]Dance.   That's the most important... 
[30]George is playing prima donna.   He wants to make you wait. 
[31]...keep moving. Don't let him put you into the corner. Stay off the rope! 
[32]Get off the ropes! Get off the ropes! Get off the ropes! Dance! 
[33]Ali, move! Dance, champ! 
[34]Get off the goddamn ropes!!
dialogues.MALCOLM X:
[1]...and those of you who think you came here to hear us tell you, like these Negro leaders do, that times will get better and we shall overcome someday, I tell you: you came to the wrong place. 
[2]'Cause your times will never get better until yo make them better. And any of you who think you came here to hear us tell you to turn the other cheek to the brutality of the white man and the established system of injustice in this country, to beg for your place at their lunch counter, I say again! You came to the wrong place. 
[3]'Cause we don't teach you to turn the other cheek. We don't teach you to turn the other cheek in the South. We don't teach you to turn the other cheek in the North. The Honorable Elijah Muhammad teaches you, instead, to obey the law. To carry yourselves in a respectable way. And a proud Afro-American way. But at the same time...we teach you...that anyone who puts his hand on you? Do your BEST...to see he doesn't PUT HIS HAND on any...body...else...AGAIN. 
[4]Just now.    I'm front row, seat 7. 
[5]Nothing wrong with being cool, my brother. You been working toward this moment for four years. 
[6]It's a crusade in modern times. And television is beaming if off Telstar to the whole world. So Allah has brought this about for a reason... Salaam alaikum, my brother... 
[7]Man, look at that guy run! 
[8]This is the champ's time. And I'm here as a friend to celebrate his victory. So I got nothing you want... 
[9]I was leaving, saw the light on...how come you're up? 
[10]I been invited to speak at Ibadan University in Nigeria. C'mon with me? 
[11]Africa.   You been there? 
[12]Nkrumah stayed with me when he was a student in New York, so we'll stop in Ghana... 
[13]Next Thursday. 
[14]You ever been so angry...have you ever been so angry that you'd explode? 
[15]What else? 
[16]...when I heard about the four girls bombed in the 16th Street Church in Birmingham? The prohibitions of the Honorable Elijah Muhammad prevented me from speaking my voice in action. Because Birmingham was part of the civil rights movement, begging for a place at the white man's table... But dead children...are dead children. So the anger I felt, I had to contain. I locked that down! So tight my muscles seized. I lost control over the right side of my body. Leg didn't work...right arm didn't work. "I'm having a stroke," I thought. I had to hold it in 'cause I wanted, all I wanted was to BREAK SOMETHING! Break a part...any part of this system. Because you are so provoked as a human being. In your spirit. In your heart... At the death of children. But I COULD DO...nothing. 
[17]Everyone knows... Now I'm advocating more direct political action involvement with the international struggle... So Elijah Muhammad has suspended me as a Minister in the Nation of Islam for 90 days. 
[18]I don't know. I will try when we get back. Until then I will live each day as if I am already dead. 
[19]What is it, Joseph? 
[20]Cassius won't be coming to Africa...not with me. 
[21]How about Gamilah or Khalilah? 
[22]Brother Muhammad... 
[23]And I heard you were coming. 
[24]When...uh, Liberia.   When you fighting Liston? 
[25]This is Maya Angelou and Ambassador Huang Ha. Amando Gonzalez is from Cuba. Taher Kaid is the Ambassador from Algeria. 
[26]Algeria. See Ben Bella... Go to Mecca, Medina. I just came back. Made my seven circuits around the Kaaba, prayed at sunrise... There were two million people...pilgrims from all over. Dressed all the same, high and low, the same. Blonde-haired, blue-eyed Muslims. Arabs. Blacks. Yeah. All of them, Muslims praying together. 
[27]It's Marlin. You'll never guess who Malcolm ran into... 
[28]Drank from the well of Zem-Zem... And you should visit Cairo. I have friends there in... 
[29]What? 
[30]Brother Muhammad... 
[31]Brother Muhammad...! 
[32]As-Salaam Alaikum... 
[33]Hold it, hold it, brothers! Let's be cool.
dialogues.SONJI:
[1]What you keep sayin' my name for? 
[2]'Bout a year. I sell "Muhammad Speaks" over the phone... 
[3]My father named me after Sonja Henie.  
[4]He was shot in a poker game when I was two. He don't do nothin'. Sonja, on the other hand, was an ice skater, and my mother died when I was eleven.  
[5]Godparents, but I been on my own, doing my own thing...  
[6]No.   I gotta work, you know.  
[7]A record player?     C'mon.    How come it don't skip?  
[8]Herbert said you met The Beatles.  
[9]...he's my favorite.  
[10]What he say? 
[11]Wow... 
[12]Yeah... 
[13]I'm takin' you there... 
[14]Well, I'm not too busy right now, so...I'll think on it. 
[15]Cover my hair? No make-up?     Long dresses? Honey, please. Were you a virgin? 
[16]'Cause you so "gone" off a little good time. 
[17]Thank you so much. 
[18]My "spirit"...? 
[19]You serious? 
[20]Huh? How you do that? Step over a broom...shazaam...you a Muslim? 
[21]Baby, maybe you ain't ever gonna be with any other. 
[22]I'm changing my damn clothes! You didn't like what I was wearin'! 
[23]I fine runnin' around in all these cute short things for you. I submissive to you. But I ain't gonna be submissive to the Brother X's and what they think. They askin' me questions alla time anyway. 
[24]About you and us and I ain't tellin' 'em shit. 
[25]I don't drink. I don't smoke. I converted to Islam for you and... 
[26]All except the dress! I ain't puttin' no bleached-out, double- ugly bedsheets on this body, honey! I'm normal! 
[27]You okay? What's wrong? 
[28]I'm dyin' and...'cause this is how I dress! I dyin' for you out of worry... 
[29]Yeah. And all you care about is if I look dull enough? 
[30]Well, sorry you don't like how I am...
dialogues.HERBERT:
[1]What? 
[2]You can't marry that girl! She was a date! Have some fun! She's not your wife! You don't marry this girl. Sign there. Management papers. My father will kill me. 
[3]Nothing to do with you. 
[4]Lana Shabazz... 
[5]Muhammad. She's not...for you. When I met her, she was working at a cocktail lounge with a bunny tail on her backside. 
[6]Sober up and say something to this man, Bundini. You supposed to be his "inspiration." 
[7]Sonji Roi is not a Muslim! 
[8]If you want, have no contact with her for ninety days. Then you make a public statement of divorce in the mosque, and Islamic law will be satisfied. 
[9]The Messenger would not object if you joined under these terms. 
[10]All you have to do is accept the induction. And life goes on. 
[11]As-Saalam Alaikum...Brother Muhammad... 
[12]The Messenger has lifted the suspension, Muhammad. Congratulations. 
[13]Yes. 
[14]I begged my father to reinstate you. 
[15]We can get you Frazier. 
[16]We can get you five million dollars for Frazier. 
[17]When you... 
[18]It's my father... 
[19]My brother! 
[20]Now that Smokin' Joe's run out of tomato cans to beat up, I finally got Yank to commit to a rematch with you in about six months. Frazier said he'd be happy with three mil... 
[21]I'll fly to Jamaica and get Yank to sign right after Joe beats this big stiff. 
[22]enters.    Ali and Herbert go to an alcove.
dialogues.BINGHAM:
[1]Watch what you signing, Ali. 
[2]You talkin' to me, or someone walk inna room, fat boy? Anything's do to with me I think's to d-d-do with me...I'm st-st-still a Christian. 
[3]I ain't goin' on your payroll. I like it freelance. Emphasis on "free." 
[4]You been s-s-saving it up, training, Champ. You can't unleash it on this girl all sudden. You may kill her! Maybe you should spread it around more before you tie it down. 
[5]You know what you j-j-just said...? 
[6]Ellis doesn't belong in there. 
[7]I saw Bundini in New York. 
[8]...bad shape. You better get your belt b-b-back... 
[9]You call your parents, Ali? 
[10]You p-p-p-promised you'd call them. 
[11]Ali, she's talkin' about "Brother" Herbert. 
[12]Bundini! 
[13]A mystery...d-d-d-daylight... 
[14]You b-b-becoming a Christian? Forgive and forget? 
[15]B-b-be easy gettin' a Frazier fight now. He ain't the champ of anything except getting knocked down. 
[16]L-l-l-lingala. 
[17]Lingala.   They s-s-s-speak Lingala. 
[18]'B-b-b-bout Hong Kong, man?!   You know what I heard? 
[19]Muhammad. Give her an Ali button! 
[20]Bo'dini, you got Ali buttons? 
[21]Belinda? 
[22]You can't beat him. You can't beat him, 'cause you can't not love him.
dialogues.DON KING:
[1]"Rumble in the Jungle!"     That's the name I given it. 
[2]A historical happening. This event will show that the black man has arrived on the world stage. Muhammad Ali and George Foreman in Kinshasa, Zaire. 
[3]Because you miss the significance. I dream, as Martin Luther King once dreamt, that a man could be judged by the content of his mind. This is about black men helping black men, overcoming four hundred years of racial depression to the dawn of a new day of liberation...financial and otherwise. 
[4]It will raise up the spirit of our inner cities. It will rise up and fill with hope the souls, the unrequited needs of the black proletariat, that is, the discouraged, dispirited, denigrated, denizens of the demimonde, that is called...the ghetto. 
[5]Ten million dollars. With one stroke of the pen, you split the world's biggest emolumation of the history of sports! 
[6]The "Rumble in the Jungle"! 
[7]Champ! Champ! George had an accident. 
[8]Got cut. Right above his right eye. His sparring partner's elbow. Split it open, so... 
[9]Not for six weeks. 
[10]This is not a humorous situation, my champion. This postponement could be long, especially if George leaves. 
[11]How right you are, my suspicious and short Italian brother. And my fiduciary responsibility to this first all-black promotion is like a garden in the African sun. It must grow! It must bloom! It cannot flower in the gloom and shade of postponement to some dome. Like the Astrodome, the Super-dome, any dome outta Zaire, where it be deprived of light and bled of water. 'Cause what gonna bleed...is money. A hemorrhage of cash. ...blood on the floor. Double hotel costs. Double travel costs. Airplanes. Food and beverage... 
[12]Muhammad. Find a way to get George to stay. Be Moses in reverse: do NOT let my people go! Stay the fuck right here, in Egypt, if you'll pardon my Swahili. 
[13]What? 
[14]Who cares? 
[15]If George goes? George goes, my champion, I will get you Joe Frazier. Ali-Frazier III...the fight everybody want to see. 
[16]You bad! 
[17]Ain't no doubt about it. 
[18]We will reschedule the fight, and to ensure George is ready, we are thinking of postponing from September 24th to October 30th. 
[19]That would go off as planned on September 22nd and 23rd. 
[20]I ain't talkin' to you! 
[21]as tall as only three other men: Foreman, Ali and Bundini, walks into the ring wearing black...
dialogues.CHAUNCEY ESKRIDGE:
[1]Yes. But I think the government's looking to negotiate a deal... 
[2]You do six weeks basic...you go into the Reserves...you don't go to Vietnam...you get to box...you even get to keep the money... 
[3]They call your name. You say yes. 
[4]You sure you want to do all this? Your next three to four years are every heavyweight's prime. And there are few of those years... 
[5]Yes... We'll be in front of the U.S. Court of Appeals next month. We'll lose. Then we appeal to the Supreme Court. 
[6]Draw a crowd or not draw a crowd, Muhammad, is NOT going to make a difference with your boxing licenses. They don't want you to fight. ACLU's handling your case against the New York Boxing Commission. They discovered New York's got actual ex-murderers and ex-rapists currently licensed to fight. But revoked yours...? 
[7]No. State Department refused permission for the one-hour visa. No fight in Tijuana. Look... 
[8]I know people in the restaurant business...want to start up a chain. Muhammad Ali's "Champ Burger"..."Muhammad Malts," "Fist Full of Fries"...all of that. 
[9]'Cause you need the money. 
[10]Too much.    They do that to you, too, you know. 
[11]Where you goin'? 
[12]...struck out at the appellate level in New Orleans. So we're heading back to the Supreme Court... 
[13]I'm petitioning on a conscientious objection basis. Religious belief. We'll petition that your sincere religious belief prohibits you from shooting people. I believe they'll hear that... 
[14]It's all over. You go to jail for five years.
dialogues.FRAZIER:
[1]Norton's big and strong, but... 
[2]Shut up.    Get in. 
[3]What the hell you in Philly for? Philly my town. 
[4]Fuck you. 
[5]I wanna fight you! Said it a hundred times. The Man won't let you fight no more. What you complainin' to me for? 
[6]We..."gotta" do nothin'!!! 
[7]What about your license? 
[8]How's that? What about the Boxing Commission? 
[9]What I got to do? 
[10]My daddy was a sharecropper. I worked in a slaughterhouse...right on that corner. I came up from nothing. What I got, I got with this. And I already got the title. So I got nothing to win and everything to lose. 
[11]Yeah..."yet." All right. You beat Quarry, I'll get inna ring and fuck you up... 
[12]You need any money or anything to tide you by...? 
[13]is wary. He doesn't trust Ali. He walks across the ring, allowing Ali to recuperate...THE BELL. Ali walks to his corner, drained...
dialogues.BRADLEY:
[1]Hello...? 
[2]Un moment... 
[3]Hold on a second... 
[4]Il n'y a pas de quoi. Cela m'a fait grand plaisir. Faites-lui mes compliments. 
[5]It's nothing. Give him my compliments. 
[6]I thought that was all over. Is Clay going to support Malcolm's U.N. resolution? 
[7]Find out. We'll pick up on Malcolm in Liberia ourselves. 
[8]Je suis avec l'Agence américane d'informations. Il ne m'est pas permis d'exprimer mes préférences entre deux citoyens des Etats-Unis. 
[9]I'm with the U.S. Information Agency. I'm not allowed to take favorites among two United States citizens... 
[10]Ce soir, le Zaire a été le sujet central dans le tous les centres européens. Félicitations, Monsieur le Président pour la vie. 
[11]Zaire was the center of the world tonight in every banking capital, all over Europe. Congratulations, President for Life.
dialogues.VERONICA:
[1]I don't think so. 
[2]Veronica Porche. 
[3]Yes. 
[4]Don brought me here, but I'm not "with"...anybody. 
[5]L.A. But my people are from Louisiana. We're Creole. So I'm African, French, Spanish, my mother's grandfather was Jewish. 
[6]You know... ...I'm glad you said what you did. You made sure this fight stays here. 
[7]Ali, boma ye. 
[8]No. 
[9]squints, trying to figure out how he did it, because...  
[10]Holdin' this in Africa make people proud. All over the world. They're proud of you. Anybody can fight in Vegas. 
[11]Islamic faith help you to that?
dialogues.PACHECO:
[1]120 over 80? You should be asleep... 
[2]She fainted... They took her to the aid station. She's okay. 
[3]Get away from her.     What is that? 
[4]It's broke. I think...I think your jaw's broke. 
[5]nods to Dundee. Dundee starts to reach. Ali snatches Angelo's hand holding the towel. Angelo's about to end the fight...  
[6]You see their fight? 
[7]And Foreman is 24. You are 32 years old. I don't want to see your head get turned into someone's bull's-eye.
dialogues.ELIJAH MUHAMMAD:
[1]Only after long service and high merit in the spiritual and physical rebirth of Afro-American people...is one granted an original name. But you are special. A world champion. So there is a gift I wish to give you. From this day forward you will be known as Muhammad Ali...which means "one worthy of praise," and Ali means "most high." 
[2]Be very careful what you say...your words reflect on the nation of Islam, now. 
[3]Up until now, I have entrusted your spiritual development to Brother Malcolm. I do not feel this is a wise course anymore. 
[4]Malcolm has gone off into the secular world and does not measure his words. I have decided to give you, as your guide, my very own son, Herbert Muhammad. 
[5]Herbert will supervise all of your spiritual and material needs. 
[6]Get me my son, Herbert, on the telephone! 
[7]Mr. Muhammad Ali desires to do that which the Holy Qur'an teaches him against. I am, therefore, suspending Mr. Ali from the practice of Islam. He may no longer appear in temple, pray or teach, or have any conversation with any Muslim whatsoever. Furthermore...he may no longer use the name of Muhammad Ali. Henceforward, he will revert to his old slave name, Cassius Clay.
dialogues.FOREMAN:
[1]darts left and jars him with three left jabs, keeping him on the rope. Foreman's training to defeat Ali's dancing, his "float + sting" tactics.   
[2]suddenly switches.  
[3]throws a right hand.     It, too, slams through Ali's guard. He's in trouble.  
[4]desperate, pounds a left to Ali's side, a blocked left to the head, three lefts to the belly, which get through! Ali's left arm convulses downwards, involuntarily, with the blows. What Ali's not ready for and doesn't block is the right hand that follows. This shot is jarring and concussive. He grabs Foreman's neck and has to hold on.  The BELL.  
[5]gets in a couple of lefts that Ali deflects. Ali takes another on the cheek, leans way back again. Suddenly, he seems tired, as is Foreman. Tied up, they go diagonally to the other corner of the ring, both fighters exhausted, leaning against each other. Resting. BUT...  
[6]backs Ali into the corner.  
[7]wrestles Ali into the center.   And the most significant moments begin...
dialogues.NIGHT:
[1]and others of the Louisville Sponsoring Group in a crowd of predominantly white people, drinking free drinks at the hastily arranged victory party, wait. Sportswriters...Jimmy Cannon, Red Smith. Cassius, Sr. is there. They all wait. No sign of Cassius. "Where's your boy?" A young New York Times sportswriter, ROBERT LIPSYTE, is there as well. He looks like he doesn't belong...his clothes are only perfunctorily conventional, and he's a generation younger.   
[2]
[3]as if they were pointing at a burning fire, sirens, blue police flashers, an isolated gunshot. And REVEAL Ali on a rooftop, in sweatpants, sweatshirt, SHADOWBOXING while...   
[4]
[5]grabbing. Holding. Ali's got Joe's powerful left tied up this time. A clinch. Separating. A punch. A hook. Clinching. They separate...  
[6]celebrate. The city is crazy with the air of liberation in the rain. People are drunk, bowing to one another, extending their arms and legs in strange gestures. Laughter. THUNDER is deafening in the downpour. People celebrate despite the storm, dancing on sidewalks on Rua Absini.
dialogues.BOB ARUM:
[1]a New York lawyer and promoter arrives and climbs out of the Oldsmobile. Ali opens the door...but doesn't get out...  
[2]I got almost nowhere I can promote a fight for you. Plus, I think they're going to vacate you from the crown. 
[3]Yeah.   If you're convicted. 
[4]And New York may revoke your boxing license. 
[5]We'll know if we can fight Terrell in Illinois this afternoon. Terrell's running his mouth. He said if you're called, you should serve... 
[6]I got to get you some fights.    Fast.
dialogues.JIMI HENDRIX:
[1]"There must be some kind of said the joker to the thief..." 
[2]"There's too much confusion, I can't get no relief. Business men, they drink my wine, plowmen dig my earth, None of them along the line, know what any of it is worth." 
[3]"No reason to get excited, the thief, he kindly spoke. There are many here among us, who feel that life is but a joke." 
[4]"But you and I, we've been and this is not our fate. So let us not talk falsely now, the hour it's getting late..." 
[5]"All along the watchtower, princes kept the view, while all the women came and went, barefoot servants, too." 
[6]"Outside in the cold distance, a wild cat did growl, two riders were approaching, and the wind began to HOWL!"
